headline: Shrimp Fried Rice
description: Learn how to make shrimp fried rice restaurant style in this flavorful recipe. Fried rice with shrimp, green onion, egg, soy sauce, and bean sprouts.

video.description: When you want it fast and fresh, make your takeout right at home!
video.name: Shrimp Fried Rice II

name: Shrimp Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups cooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined without tail

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes. Set aside and allow rice to cool.
Heat a large skillet or wok for 2 minutes. When the skillet or wok is hot, pour in vegetable oil, bean sprouts, and onions. Mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Mix in cooled rice and shrimp and cook for another 3 minutes. Stirring constantly.
Add in eggs, green onion, soy sauce, salt, pepper, and sesame oil. Cook for another 4 minutes, stirring continuously, until eggs are cooked and everything is blended evenly.

review.reviewBody: very simple and delicious, with some changes i added 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce i swapped 3 tablespoons of veg oil for sesame chili oil and a light olive oil. cooked eggs and shrimp separately. i sautÃ©d the onions and bean sprouts. fried the rice in the sesame oil added soy sauce and oyster sauce then combined and cooked for about 2 minutes .
I tried this and found it bland. Going to try again with less rice and more onions, some garlic to spice it up a little.
I already had cooked rice so this took me 15 minutes! Delicious!
I thought this was terrific. Scrambled the eggs separately. Used 2 T soy and 1T toasted sesame oil. Might be a go-to for left over chicken

I've made this with a twist. I cooked my rice the day before which is best. I cooked my shrimp separately as well as the eggs. I sauteed my onions with garlic and a little ginger root for about 3 minutes and then added the bean sprouts. I then put the cooked rice in the wok with the soy sauce and some Chinese 5spice seasoning. I then added everything to the rice once the soy sauce coated all the rice. And I played it and topped it with raw scallions. I wish I had taken a picture. Because mines looked better than the picture posted. And when I say it was delicious... IT TRULY WAS and you don't need the at ALL.
I followed the directions in the recipe and this tastes sooo good. I cooked the shrimp in a little oil and minced garlic before incorporating it with the rice.
It was easy and very simple to make and turned out delicious ðŸ˜‹

I added mushrooms and carrots shredded along with brown sugar mixed with the soy sauce, fish sauce and oyster sauce - and a touch of red pepper flakes - be careful - they are v hot! Easy and delicious. Serve w low salt soy sauce (a bit more might be needed) and I like the sweet chili sauce on the side and it was perfect.
The 3rd time and it comes out great
Delicious and simple
Easy to make and it was delicious. Does it make a difference if shrimp is peeled or not? I didn't peel mine

Have made this many times. I cook the rice ahead of time and let it cool. I always add either frozen peas or sugar snap peas. I scramble the beaten egg in a well in the centre of the wok. I always add the bean sprouts in step 3 and I omit the salt. Tastes great, even reheated. Thanks for the recipe.
Kind of bland
I added mushrooms otherwise followed it the way it was written

I was looking for a way to use my left over bean sprouts that I didnâ€™t use in Pad Thai and I found this recipe. The only thing I added was some frozen mixed veggies. A couple points. Skip the salt. The soy sauce has plenty. Also, cook and chop the eggs before adding to the rice. Following the recipe, I added the raw eggs to the rice which then became mushy.
Not sure yet!

Followed the recipe except I did not add salt and used low sodium soy sauce. Also used diced carrots and frozen peas instead of the sprouts. Added some powder ginger to taste and it was so good. Will make this again and try it with chicken.
Did the same ingredients exactly except leaving the rice overnight and it turned out way too salty.
Delicious! I made this but my teen wouldn't eat it, so more for me! Used 3 tablespoons of light soy sauce and added in halved pea pods near the end.
The recipe is perfect! No modifications needed

Instructions easy to follow, I wasnâ€™t able to find bean sprouts or green onions at my store with everything going on but I added shallots and mini bell peppers and it came out delicious! Makes a whole bunch and paired with a stovetop orange chicken makes this a complete meal! (Because I can only put *so much* effort into dinner) Adding this to my list to impress company!
Yea didn't use some ingredients still came out good....
No I didn't make any changes and yes i will make it again without the sprouts.
I used leftover rice from a previous meal and added other veggies that I had.
Delicious. near restaurant quality.
Great!!!!!

It was awesome
Thank you
My family LOVED this. I added pea and carrots and even my pickiest eater said "Mom, I'm eating the carrots!" I'll definitely be making again!
Scored a 5 star with my family!!
I used brown rice. Added pineapple, watermelon radish, boy chop...so good and full of color!
Yes I will my family loves it

I have now made this recipe twice. It is excellent! I added a small bag of peas and carrots this time. I agree with what others have said about the egg. Last time, it seemed to disappear when I mixed it in. This time I pushed the rice et all to one side of the pan and soft scrambled the eggs before incorporating them into the rice.
Very good will make it again, used a little more shrimp and would againe
Use less water than it calls for, 1 cup for every 1 1/2 cups of rice. Other than that, it's perfect.

I used previous cooked rice (day old) and it still turned out mushy. The recipe should specify to scramble eggs separate and then add to recipe. The flavor was there, but the text was lacking bad. Iâ€™ll try it again.

I have a research projects (technically culinary arts) class. We made this and it turned out amazing! A touch of sesame oil definitely spikes the flavor. Iâ€™d suggest adding some more color by using diced bell peppers (red, yellow, orange, green).
This was delish! My picky husband even had seconds. I was out of a few ingredients but was looking for something to do with some veggies that needed to be used up.

Very easy and quick. I cooked my rice the day before and it came out just how I wanted it to. I also used a splash of olive oil. Make sure the oil is heated on high heat for a minute or two before cooking the rice so. Love this meal!

Super simple recipe. Always turns out great. I use instant rice instead of the regular rice because I need stuff to be quick, also because I'm terrible at cooking regular rice. Still do my instant rice a few hours before preparing so that the moisture is mostly gone.
I use this recipe all the time. I've substituted shrimp with chicken and any sort of sprout that I had on hand, and it still turns out great.

I will definitely make this again. Delicious and very easy The only changes i made were 1) used about 2 cups of shrimp 
 2) added about a cup of frozen green peas when i put in the shrimp and rice 
2) pushed all ingredients to the side of the pan at the end of the final step and "scramble" an extra egg to toss into the cooked final product
very good! I added a few veggies and definitely will make again!
I will make it again I only put half the soy salt which was a good idea.Nexx time I will scramble the eggs and the add to other ingredients.

This was so good and easy to make. I used jasmine rice and I didn't have green onion which would have been even better but I had some zucchini I needed to use so I chopped that up and threw in and was really good. Don't omit the salt like some people have said. Definitely will make this again and again!
next time I wont cook the rice all the way as it is too mushy when the final cooking is done
A little more labor intensive than some fried rice recipes I've tried but not too bad.
Didnâ€™t have bean sprouts so used carrots and added some chili oil for a kick. Very good
This has become one of our favs. I did substitute some frozen veggies for the bean sprouts since we don't like them, but still very good!
It thought it was too wet. Fried rice should be fluffy, this was soggy.

We found this recipe to be bland and lacking flavor. It was easy to put together and that is a plus. I noticed that the recipe uses cooked shrimp and I adjusted the recipe so that they would not be overcooked. Shrimp need to be cooked for 2-3 minutes, not 6 or 7. I would also suggest adding some fresh ginger for flavor.

Just finished having this for lunch.
Can't wait for dinner to have it again
Will definitely make it again! Delicious!
Made it twice already! Such a easy and delicious dish, added extra veggies.
Came out great! Be careful with the sesame oil, it can overpower your meal. I may skip it next time.
Yes, I sautÃ©ed the shrimp in xtra vrgn olive oil with salt and old bay. The recipe was excellent , thank you ! !
It turned out great and absolutely I would do it again
This dish was easy and delicious, both my husband and I loved it. I did add oyster sauce for more flavor.
I drained a can of peas and carrots then added it to the last step. Family loved it.
Made rice night before so it was very cold . Used a little more soy sauce and scallions. Everyone liked it a lot. Very easy
Great. My husband made it and it was very good. Certainly will make this again. He added ginger, but needed a little more.
The only thing I will change next time is scrambling the eggs separately and then adding them in, instead of adding them to the whole skillet. As for taste, it's delicious!
I was very please with this dish, because my whole family ate it.

I think this rice could have had way more potential. As a warning, I did not have bean sprouts or green onions on hand. It seemed like those two flavors were definitely missed in this recipe. 

I used leftover, refrigerated basmati rice from a couple of days ago (to keep it as firm as possible), and raw shrimp (to not over cook them). I agree that adding the egg in the rice made the texture completely undesirable, so I would recommend cooking the egg 3/4 of the way (in a separate skillet) before adding it to the rice. 

I'd also recommend seasoning the shrimp beforehand (even with something as simple salt and pepper)... the shrimp could have had a nice pop, but it was plain instead. I'd also recommend putting the shrimp in and cooking it 1/2 way before putting the rice in (if it's raw).
My husband and I enjoyed this dish. It said 4 servings and only served two. We are not especially big eaters. Used brown rice
A huge hit with my family - we havenâ€™t eaten Chinese food since going gluten-free for health reasons. Everyone loved the recipe and weâ€™ll definitely be making it again!
Quick, easy, and delicious.

Tastes a little too much sesame oil, but next time I will add carrots and peas, maybe cook the sesame oil with the regular oil or even mix it with the rice before adding to shrimp, bean sprouts and onions! Overall very fast and easy to put together!!!

While this is a good dish, i think it has to much salt.I did not add as much as the recipes states. I did not add the soy sauce and used 1/2 teaspoon salt. I also used Italian rice ( Arborio) as I find it holds its shape better then regular rice.I had no problem with the shrimp, it did not get over done.That being said it was very good , Iâ€™m giving it a five for flavour.
Thank you for the recipe.
I will definitely make it again. It was delicious!
I couldn't follow this recipe it called for chicken stock. But wasn't used and the recipe ingredients never mentioned eggs

Really good recipe, easy t follow, with basic ingredients. I took it down to 3 tablespoons of soy and added water chestnuts halfway through the onion caramalization and felt like they were a good addition. Would recommend this to any fan of friend rice or shrimp.

Made this for dinner this evening and it was amazing! It has been added to my "make again list"
I did however tweek it a little, I used 1 c onion instead of bean sprouts, used dried green onions (since thats all I had), in step 3 i added the rice and let cook a minute before adding in frozen broccoli, frozen sliced carrots, garlic powder, and used small frozen cooked shrimp instead of medium (more shrimp to the bite that way.) Glad I made enough for lunch tomorrow cause man, I want more!
Easy, loved this recipe. Added a cup of frozen peas and carrots mix. Also used large shrimp. Perfect!
it was good...but not the best...but better then i think i would do...

This is a very quick, easy recipe. However I would not add the extra salt and use 3 tablespoons of soy sauce as my end product was pretty salty. This is my fault, however, for not tasting the dish before I added all four tablespoons and the extra salt. Just keep in mind when cooking, you can always add more seasonings but you can hardly ever take away!

Great easy, simple recipe. My boys 13 & 17 loved it. My 17y.o. Even ate it for breakfast the next day, and he's my picky eater. As a matter of fact, it was his idea.The only thing I did additional was added chicken(john souls chicken strips, quick simple) for a little more protein(my teenage boys are always hungry)As always my family are the real judges, this one is definitely a DO OVER!!!! Thanks again for sharing

Easy and fast. I would add peas and heavy hand the soy and sesame. Cook the eggs with the onions and sprouts first before adding rice and shrimp, they will gain better texture. Save some salt, pepper and green onions to season an garnish once done.
Next time I am going to cook the egg separately and probably omit the bean sprouts. It was kind of mushy following the directions as written.

After reading some of the other reviews, I cooked my eggs separately. I cooked my rice the night before. I used fresh shrimp. I added peas and carrots, a little corn, frozen string beans. I added a dash more sesame oil. Other than that I followed the recipe and it was delish.

Wow. This is so good!! Here's what I did: very hot wok, a tbsp of veg oil, added grated carrot, chopped celery and onion, tossed into the wok until softened, about 3 to 4 mins, then added finely chopped fresh garlic just until the aroma hit me, maybe a minute more to soften it. Removed completely from wok, then added about a tbsp of oil and cooled rice, tossed for about 3 mins, and returned the carrot mixture to the wok with some thawed peas and corn. Tossed until incorporated. I scrambeld 2 eggs, salt, pepper and a handful of chopped green onion in a frying pan until loosely set and added it to the rice with 3 tbsp of soy sauce, a splash of sesame oil, cooked shrimp and just a little more fresh green onion. Tossed together until combined and hot and... Incredible. I even had a jar of Chinese 5 spice on hand and at quick reach just incase, because I really didn't understand how this could possibly be flavourful on its own, but completely unnecessary. Best fried rice I have ever had. No joke. I can't believe how good this was!! Super easy too!

Made it as is. Only change is that I used raw shrimp, not precooked. Came out good! Will make again. Could also add peas, baby corn, water chestnuts or mushrooms. Not add alot, but they would go well in there, too. Thx for sharing!
I loved this recipe i just made one small adjustment i put garlic for extra taste.I added more rice to the ingredients and soy sause to my taste delicious thank you.
I Like

I added peas and pineapple to mine. I also cooked the rice the night before to avoid soggy rice. Verry good recipe. I use peanut oil for all my fried rice. I made it for a house warming. So I prepped everything except the rice that same day. I saved the pineapple juice for the sweet and sour that I made for the egg roll I made.
I made this without the sprouts, but added peas and it came out great. Very tastes!
Very good, easy supper. Good enough for company. Made 3 servings which were just right for my husband and myself.
Even with adding some additional ingredients, it was still too bland for me.

This was the best shrimp fried rice I have ever tasted, and sooo easy!! I followed the recipe exactly as it was written, and would not change a thing. I served it with Grilled Chinese pork chops, Asparagus mushroom stir fry...The taste was wonderful!! Thankyou so much for sharing. This recipe is truly a Keeper!!

Shrimp fried rice is my favorite of all time to be able to make it-competently - is sooo great for me. This recipe worked for me. I took one of the reviewers advice, bought a wok, lowered the sesame, and used ready made rice . Cha ching!. Love it.

I make this recipe often changing it a little by adding a cup of julienne cut carrots and a cup of frozen early peas and I only add half the rice. My husband is on a low carb diet (45 to 50 carbs per meal) and the changes makes this a dish he can enjoy guilt free. It also makes for a colorful and visually appealing meal. I also use Geisha canned bean sprouts because our very rural location makes fresh bean sprouts hard to find and keep on hand.
Husband loved it! Made it with jasmine rice. Delicious.

This was very nice. I added a bit of chopped pork and mushrooms to the mix. No onion (too lazy) and no red pepper (don't really like) and it turned out very tasty. Don't do like me and only put in 1/2 the ratio of water to the rice. It was still edible...just. Will make again with the rice well cooked! :-)
easy to make and very tasty
I didn't add the bean sprouts, but did add about a tablespoon of sesame oil to give it more flavor. I must say this taste as authentic as any shrimp fried rice I've ever purchased!

I always try to make recipes exactly the first time. That's the only way I can judge it. The only difference here was that I used brown rice, which does change the texture. We all enjoyed the meal but felt it was "just ok". I agree with others about the egg. If I made this version again, I would go back to scrambling the egg separately.
easy to make. I would lessen the amount of soy sauce, as it is a bit salty and I did not use any salt. Otherwise it was a delicious dish.
Came out excellent
Loved this recipe! Tastes better than a restaurant! My husband doesn't eat this when we order Chinese take out but he LOVED mine!

The only reason I gave a 3 star is because I would had like for someone to tell me to cook the egg first then add it. Even though the flavor was great the result was not what I expected. The rice way to sticky, close to mushy and this because of adding the eggs last. 

I recommend this recipe if you are looking for an authentic flavor.
